question: Traversing a data structure means accessing each element exactly once.
Insertion refers to removing an element from a data structure.
Deletion in an array involves shifting elements to fill the removed element's space.
Traversing an array allows modification of its elements while accessing them.
In an array, insertion at any position requires shifting elements to maintain order.
Deletion of an element from an array reduces its size automatically.
Insertion in an array always happens at the end without shifting other elements.
Traversing an array with a loop can be done using a for or while loop in C.
Insertion and deletion operations in arrays are always O(1) in time complexity.
After deleting an element from an array, the remaining elements must be shifted to maintain continuity.
